condoning.question: Did I, through my words, lead other Catholics to think it is acceptable to stay away from Sacraments or Mass?

condoning.description: As part of the corporal works of mercy, we're called to be merciful and compassionate to those in distress.

extracted_data_phrases: to influences that might undermine their faith

blasphemy.question: Did you swear to God in anger, frustration, or when speaking impulsively?
blasphemy.description: This sin violates the Second Commandment by treating God's holy name with disrespect rather than reverence.

blasphemy.question: Have you used God's name to swear in frustration, anger, or thoughtlessness?
blasphemy.description: This sin violates the Second Commandment by treating God's holy name with disrespect rather than reverence.

blasphemy.question: Did you receive Holy Communion, knowing yourself unworthy to partake in it?
blasphemy.description: This mortal sin is a form of sacrilege and profanes the real presence of Christ and shows grave disrespect for the sacrament by receiving unworthily.

extracted_data_phrases: for the real presence of Christ
blasphemy.question: Did I receive Holy Communion while knowingly being in a state of sin, thereby showing grave disrespect for the real presence of Christ?
blasphemy.description: This mortal sin is a form of sacrilege and profanes the real presence of Christ and shows grave disrespect for the sacrament by receiving unworthily.

extracted_data_phrases: while knowingly in a state of sin
blasphemy.question: Did I receive Holy Communion while knowingly in a state of sin, thus profaning the Real Presence of Christ?
blasphemy.description: This mortal sin is a form of sacrilege and profanes the real presence of Christ and shows grave disrespect for the sacrament by receiving unworthily.

ambition.question: Did I let my desire for power and dominance influence the way I treat and make decisions regarding those in positions of authority, such as leaders or superiors?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

extracted_data_phrases: through my thoughts , words , and actions
ambition.question: Did my own desire for power and dominance influence how I relate to others through my thoughts, words, and actions?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

greed.question: Did I make accumulation of money and possessions a driving force in my life, leading me to prioritize material wealth over God's providence?
greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

such as wealth , property , or other goods ,

greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

greed.question: Have I made accumulation a driving force in my life, placing material possessions above God's providence?
greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

extracted_data_phrases: through your words , actions , or decisions
oppression.question: Did you mistreat, harass, or discriminate against others through your words, actions, or decisions?
oppression.description: It's a sin to execute an unjust and cruel exercise of power or authority over others instead of respecting the God-given dignity of every human person.

autonomy.question: Did I take for granted the blessings in my life, forgetting to acknowledge them as gifts from God's providence?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

extracted_data_phrases: without giving thanks to God for their presence
autonomy.question: Have I taken for granted the good things in my life, such as family and relationships, without giving thanks to God for their presence?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

envy.question: Have I felt discontent for others' blessings, leading me to secretly wish they would lose them?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

extracted_data_phrases: in a way that is unbecoming of one 's Christian character
incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control and speak to others in a way that is unbecoming of one's Christian character, using language that is coarse or inappropriate?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control in my conversations with others, using language that was unbecoming or hurtful?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

gluttony.question: Did I overindulge in eating or drinking, especially when socializing or celebrating special occasions?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

prodigality.question: Have I allowed excessive and wasteful gambling to take precedence over my responsibilities towards those in need?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

prodigality.question: Have I recklessly prioritized frivolous spending over my financial responsibilities, potentially harming our ability to provide for family needs?

prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

gossip.question: Have I used others' private affairs, even if true, for my own entertainment or pleasure in discussions about them?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

anger.question: Have I nursed anger or held onto feelings of rage rather than seeking reconciliation in my interactions with family members, especially when disagreeing on important matters?
anger.description: Uncontrolled anger corrupts our own heart, damages our relationship with both God and neighbor.
